meanings.definition: A medieval chemical science and speculative philosophy aiming to achieve the transmutation of base metals into gold.
meanings.sent1: In the olden days, alchemy was believed to turn ordinary metals into precious gold.
meanings.sent2: The alchemy of the past sought to transform common metals into valuable treasures.
meanings.sent3: The wizard's attempt at alchemy turned his copper coins into chocolate coins!
meanings.sent4: Her cooking skills were like alchemy, turning simple ingredients into gourmet dishes.
meanings.sent5: The alchemy of nature can be seen in the changing colors of the leaves in autumn.

meanings.definition: A seemingly magical process of transformation, creation, or combination.
meanings.sent1: The artist's alchemy transformed a blank canvas into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: Love has a mysterious alchemy that can heal even the deepest wounds.
meanings.sent3: The alchemy of friendship turned their differences into strengths.
meanings.sent4: The alchemy of storytelling weaves words into enchanting tales.
meanings.sent5: Music has a magical alchemy that can uplift the soul.
